stream_context.summary: Kaze live-reviews and debugs the large re-work of Course 5 (the Ghost-Ship) while briefly showing the new western saloon hub. He fixes N64-specific rendering/engine issues, plans puzzle tweaks, and coordinates art and music updates.

development_findings.summary: The ghost-ship exterior was completely rebuilt (≈1 700 tris) by Biobak; Kaze must convert several textures (alpha → CI4/RGBA16) and move window meshes to layer 4 to avoid Z-sorting issues.
development_findings.quote: First of all, dude, this is sick looking… but these need to be moved to layer 6 or this is going to be a rendering issue.

development_findings.summary: Clear-color fill is disabled to gain ~3 ms per frame (≈10 % of N64 render budget).
development_findings.quote: This game on purpose doesn't have a clear color because applying the clear color takes around three milliseconds which is like ten percent of the render time.

development_findings.summary: Lightning effect relies on subtracting environment colour; geometry changes broke it and Kaze restores two-cycle combiner with shade subtraction.
development_findings.quote: You need lighting to do nth mapping… we can’t have lighting and vertex colours at the same time.

development_findings.summary: New pushable bookshelf puzzle: red-scratched shelf must slide to reveal path; Kaze will make it protrude slightly and add visual scratches to improve readability.
Timed switch that used to spawn blocks will now open a relocated door to the Shy-Guy mini-game; cut-scene camera will show the door and possibly re-close on a timer.
Front plank will become a springy diving board that can launch Mario to the upper rope and hide a Yoshi coin; Kaze adds it to his to-do list.
Skybox and water will be blended: skybox fades to a colour in view-space, sea geometry fades into same colour for seamless horizon.
development_findings.quote: Make skybox fade into colour at bottom; make sea fade into same colour.

development_findings.summary: Coin texture looked out of style; Kaze converts to IA4/IA8 and adjusts brightness to match ship palette.
Crash traced to obsolete texture-animation channels after geometry shift; removing or remapping those channels fixes a ‘matrix underflow’.
development_findings.quote: It was detect channels. We need to remake the texture animations, that’s what’s going on here.

development_findings.summary: Engine and full source will be released open-source when the hack ships; withheld for now to avoid accidental leak.
development_findings.quote: When I release this hack my engine will be public. I’ll make the hack open source at the same time.

context_findings.summary: Kaze views difficulty as optional: he prefers clear ideas over hard puzzles, calling extra challenge ‘unnecessary’.
context_findings.quote: This is good because we are showing a cool idea… Difficulty here is unnecessary.

context_findings.summary: He is performance-obsessed, repeatedly trading visuals for N64 frame-time savings (clear colour removal, layer choices).
Frustration with CAPTCHA and crashes; excitement and praise for Biobak’s art; playful antagonism toward chat.
context_findings.quote: How can we have 170 viewers? I didn’t do anything!

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on programming labour: believes many industry programmers are over-paid and under-worked.
context_findings.quote: Programmers are the laziest people on the planet… they just scroll Reddit all day.

context_findings.summary: Will open-source tools but only after release to prevent leaks; shows protective attitude toward project.

biobak.summary: Delivered full exterior and interior overhaul of Course 5, including new cannon holes, anchors, sails, treasure room, captain’s quarters, and lighting passes.
biobak.quote: All the actors and shit are visible in the modelling tab… Shipping updated textures and lighting and vibe.

biobak.summary: Inserted detailed change-log inside Blender file; coordinated live with Kaze on texture formats and UV tweaks.

badub.summary: Sent first draft of saloon music; Kaze judged it ‘too upbeat’ and too similar to previous zoo track; composer agreed to revise.
badub.quote: The beginning of it is kind of like the zoo level… It’s a nice song but it doesn’t quite have the vibe I’m looking for.

key_stories.title: Geometry Overhaul Causes Hard Crash
key_stories.summary: After importing Biobak’s rebuilt ship, the game crashed on load. Kaze used a custom debugging emulator and iterative object removal to isolate the fault.
key_stories.challenge: Matrix underflow crash when level loaded.
key_stories.process: Removed objects in batches, suspected coin formations, then texture animations; confirmed ‘detect channels’ referencing deleted vertices.
key_stories.outcome: Crash fixed by remaking texture-animation lists; level now loads.
key_stories.key_quote: It was detect channels. We need to remake the texture animations.

key_stories.title: Saloon Music Mismatch
key_stories.summary: Badub delivered a saloon theme that felt cheerful and recycled. Kaze compared it to Paper Mario’s pirate town track and provided reference music.
key_stories.challenge: Music mood didn’t fit dark, dusty saloon vibe.
key_stories.process: Live feedback; played reference; composer acknowledged issue.
key_stories.key_quote: Too upbeat and happy… he says he’s changing it.

key_stories.title: Pushable Bookshelf Puzzle Redesign
key_stories.summary: New library room puzzle risked being too opaque for players.
key_stories.challenge: Visual hinting insufficient for sliding shelf mechanic.
key_stories.process: Added scratch marks, coin marker, and plans to make shelf protrude slightly.
key_stories.key_quote: This is not good because this is a hard puzzle to figure out… we should make this come out a little bit.

open_questions.context: Biobak felt shark boss area was hard and asked for coins; Kaze unsure.
questions: Could alternative healing (e.g., milk bottles) be more thematic?

open_questions.context: Idea to link ship’s treasure map to Ice-Cap entrance was noted but not planned.
questions: How concretely will the map hint at Ice-Cap?
Will it affect gameplay or be purely lore?

open_questions.context: Kaze undecided on adding exterior skybox light bleed into new room.
questions: Will adding skybox light improve mood without hurting performance?
Do we need in-room light sources if skybox used?

open_questions.context: Timed switch now opens door instead of spawning blocks; cut-scene timing unclear.
questions: What camera framing best teaches player the link?

open_questions.context: Plank will bounce Mario upward and may hide Yoshi coin.
questions: Exact physics values for fun but reliable height?
Should it serve as alternate path speedrunners can exploit?
